alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 24 at 2:07PM PST until January 26 at 8:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 7 to 10 feet with local sets to 12 feet and dangerous rip currents. Surf will be highest on west- facing beaches. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Central Coast and Santa Barbara County Central Coast. * WHEN...Until 8 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for drowning due to the dangerous conditions. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Stay off rocks and rock jetties, as they can be deadly locations in such conditions.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast
